alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:21AM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 AM EST, the automated gauge on Duck Creek at Macksburg was at 14.8 feet and is slowly rising. At stages between 13 and 14 feet, businesses next to the gauge, intersection of State Route 821 and Broad Street, State Route 81 at Main Street, some homes, and several sections of roads along Duck Creek are flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
